text:
Not to really burst your bubble. But young people playing old games aren't *that* unique. The majority of the people makes it appear so, but in what I've experienced, there's not so much to it. Everyone like different games and genres, young or old.

I've actually seen a lot more older people playing high-rated, milked game franchises than people think kids would play.

The 3DS for example. Younglings buys it and then they notices the sShop which gives you the chance to buy "retro" games.

author: rellim10

text:
It's amazing because it's so fitting... While many songs can sound fitting, or make you think of an environment, this actually sounds like a cave singing.

The main horn, it blares through the cave as if it were the trunk of a massive, trumpeting elephant. The airy wind instrument follow-up is the whistle of wind through the cave system, weaving as though through a colossal flute. The tinkling in the background is the singing of long-hidden crystals and the steady dripping of underground lakes.
